ygData.subject: Re: Boat problems
ygData.msgSnippet: I think that you have to send a petition each time you log on - I think that they go away when you log out.  Keep logging in and petition each time - my best
ygData.messageBody:
I think that you have to send a petition each time you log on - I think that
they go away when you log out. Keep logging in and petition each time - my
best guess. HIH

Sylly.

-----Original Message-----
From: Jack Naugle [mailto:zendarin@...]
Sent: Wednesday, June 23, 1999 10:38 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Boat problems

From: Jack Naugle <zendarin@...>

I'm not sure what to do, maybe someone has some advice for
me. While sitting
calmly on the deck of the boat on my way to Faydwer, I
suddenly found myself
sitting on a rock in the middle of OOT surrounded by Sirens
and Aqua-goblins
with the boat nowhere in sight. I have been stuck there for
2 days now. I
petitioned immediately of course, but there were no GM's on
then. I have
logged back in morning, afternoon, and evening but only once
saw a GM log
on. They were on less than 5 minutes and logged off again
without answering
my petition. I've tried to catch the boat in passing, but
don't stand a
chance of catching it. I don't want to abandon my bard, my
guild has
invested too much into helping me catch up with them in
levels.

Zendarin
The Wandering Minstrel
Frustrated on Fennin Ro
